title: Arbitrary file download due to bad handling of Redirects in WebTorrent
vulnerability_information:
## Summary:

Previously I reported  #963155 how an attacker can trick user into downloading malicious files using ".save torrent" feature, In this report I am going to reproduce the same behavior but by abusing a different feature.

## Description

While I was testing webtorrent on brave I noticed that whenever webtorrent detects a torrent file a request is made to the following extension scheme 
```
chrome-extension://lgjmpdmojkpocjcopdikifhejkkjglho/extension/brave_webtorrent.html?{torrent_url/magnet_link}
```

WebTorrent also consider a URL a valid torrent file if a URI starts with a `magnet:` scheme or if it ends with a `.torrent` extension for example:-

```
chrome-extension://lgjmpdmojkpocjcopdikifhejkkjglho/extension/brave_webtorrent.html?http://xyz.com?x=.torrent
chrome-extension://lgjmpdmojkpocjcopdikifhejkkjglho/extension/brave_webtorrent.html?magnet%3Ablahblah
```
Both the above URIs will be considered as a valid torrent file by WebTorrent (Refer below SS).

{F977576}

Another behavior that I observed was, when opening a URL `http://xyz.com?x=.torrent` will serve a normal response but one can force it to be opened with WebTorrent using the extensions scheme `chrome-extension://lgjmpdmojkpocjcopdikifhejkkjglho/extension/brave_webtorrent.html?http://xyz.com?x=.torrent`

Also, if a website for example, `http://xyz.com` redirects to `http://abc.com` then one can interrupt the redirection and can force it to open the source site via webtorrent before the redirection takes place. This behavior can be leveraged by an attacker to redirect a user to a malicious website or can force user to download a malicious file onto their system (for more better understanding please refer the Steps-to-Reproduce section) .

## Tested on

* Brave Version 1.12.114 Chromium: 84.0.4147.135 (Windows)

## Steps To Reproduce:

* Visit https://php-demo-app-shibli.cfapps.io/brave/brave-poc.html
* Click on "Save .torrent file" option
* "Poison.bat" file will be downloaded onto your machine

An attacker can also use this to redirect the user to a malicious webpage. See below POC video

{F977593}

## Impact

Remote Code Execution
Remote JavaScript execution
Installing malware on client's machine
Phishing

Any updates??
Checking in with Feross about this. Yesterday was a holiday btw. Generally give us 1-2 business days to triage a report.
Thanks for the response, Actually I am in IST timezone so didn't realise that ðŸ˜….
@d3f4u17 did you test this on Nightly? My fix (not yet out in Stable) should prevent the behavior where it downloads a .bat file. I'll check if it handles the redirect though.

Actually your PoC link isn't working for me in Stable or Nightly (MacOS). When I go to  https://php-demo-app-shibli.cfapps.io/brave/brave-poc.html and click the link, it gets blocked and redirects to chrome://invalid.
I think my last fix may have also fixed the redirect issue. Please try this out on Nightly. Thanks! https://brave.com/download-nightly/

Hi @diracdeltas ,

I tested this on nightly and I am still able to reproduce this issue, please refer the below PoC video

{F982047}

**Just a note:- Try downloading a valid torrent file before trying the PoC.**

Hi @diracdeltas ,

I have also updated PoC a little bit, https://php-demo-app-shibli.cfapps.io/brave/brave-poc.html

I have added the following line

```javascript
<script>window.open("valid torrent file link");</script>
```

This will basically enable/initiate the chrome-extension scheme for WebTorrent.
I still cannot repro this on MacOS unfortunately. I will ask someone on windows to verify this.
Actually I just had to reload the page after disabling the popup blocker. However when I download the file, it saves as xss.torrent, not a .bat. (from https://exec.ga/browser/brave/xss.torrent)
If i reload it downloads the .bat file. Can you share the PHP snippet for this? I'm not sure I understand what the server is doing.
Can you share a video, actually m not able to understand what all steps u r following.
Also please find the attached php and html files.

The only reason I added a line to open https://exec.ga/browser/brave/xss.torrent in a new window is to initiate the webtorrent extension, previously when you were getting `chrome://invalid` is because you were trying to open the WebTorrent's `chrome-extension` scheme which doesn't exists in a freshly installed nightly browser.

To remove the confusion I have reverted all the changes that I had done yesterday in the PoC, now please follow the below steps to Reproduce the issue.

**Note: - before following the below steps, open a valid torrent file via webtorrent**

* now open https://php-demo-app-shibli.cfapps.io/brave/brave-poc.html
* Click on "save .torrent file" 
* .bat file will be saved.
Great, thanks. Pretty sure I know how to fix this but probably won't get around to it until next week.
Great, I am eager too to know the actual reason behind this issue because I have lots of other theories regarding it which can lead to more other severe issues

there's at least 3 issues here that i can see:

1. https://github.com/brave/brave-core/blob/master/components/brave_webtorrent/browser/webtorrent_util.cc#L42 < should check url.path() not url.spec() when deciding whether to redirect a request to webtorrent extension. 

2. pages should not be able to open chrome-extension:// links. not sure what is causing this. would be a more serious bug if it happens for all extensions, not just webtorrent. 

3. something in https://github.com/brave/brave-core/commit/4217a80e64f57fda8fdb13a013e793d20d2e3d85#diff-f353360dec4a30936990a5e09d09068fR38 is missing the .bat redirect case
I think we should increase the severity of this report based on the above causes and yeah `chrome-extension` links can be opened for any extension I guess and not just for webtorrent

so actually we just remembered that any extension will allow external pages to link to extension pages by listing the page in `web_accessible_resources`. so this is probably expected behavior unless you are able to link to a page that isn't listed in the extension's web_accessible_resources. https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/manifest/web_accessible_resources

the reason this works on the 2nd try but not the first is that webtorrent is lazy-loaded.
we do actually need those files in web_accessible_resources in webtorrent; discussion here from a year ago: https://github.com/brave/brave-core/pull/2988#discussion_r311874416
https://github.com/brave/brave-core/pull/6654 is merged so this should be fixed in the next nightly build
the amount is slightly lower than last time because this attack requires convincing someone to load another torrent in webtorrent first
Thank you very much for the bounty, I will retest the issue in the latest nightly build to verify the fix.
Requesting public disclosure
